result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree C Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 days time served. Huber privileges to apply for work, child care, and treatment.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Payment must be made within the first 6 months of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain GED or HSED. The defendant must enroll within 3 weeks.

No firearms; weapons ever.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with the victim.
Court approves the use of 3rd party contact for child visitation purposes.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction following the successful completion of sentence.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on November 6, 2015.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with credit for zero days time served, consecutive to count 1. Huber privileges to apply for work, child care, and treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served. Huber privileges to apply for work, child care, and treatment.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
AS TO COUNT 4:
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months in the House of Correction with credit for zero days time served, consecutive to count 1. Huber privileges to apply for work, child care, and treatment. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim.
-Court approves the use of 3rd party contact for child visitation purposes.
-Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Payment must be made within the first 6 months of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms; weapons ever.
-Obtain GED or HSED. The defendant must enroll within 3 weeks.
-Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction following the successful completion of sentence.
Received and filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/12/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  William Berens for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Sarra Mae Kiaie  for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
